snp2.12:10.3: _Kāmakāro_: “wish-maker”. At [kv23.3]() _issariyakāmakārikā_ means a “sovereign act of will”. Commentary here says ordinary people may not simply know or say what they want.
snp2.12:10.4: _Saṅkheyyakāro_: “comprehensibility-maker”. _Saṅkheyya_ is “calculable, comprehensible”, not “after comprehension”. The Buddha has a gift for explaining things in a way that makes them clear.
